info.title: GovDoc Copilot: PM Edition
info.description: Your AI copilot for preparing government project gate submissions. Guides PMs through drafting, reviewing, and finalizing project documentation.

get.summary: List available tools for GPT use

x-gpt-action.name: List Available Tools
x-gpt-action.instructions: Call this to get a list of tools that are available for use in this assistant. Only tools marked as GPT-facing will be returned.

200.description: Returns an array of tool metadata including tool_id, description, and schema if applicable

description.example: Retrieve required sections and criteria for an artifact

post.summary: Retrieve artifact options and requirements for a gate

x-gpt-action.name: Get Artifact Requirements
x-gpt-action.instructions:
Use this when a user is starting a new artifact. Ask which gate they are preparing for (0–5). Pass:
- `gate_id`: integer (see values below)

This returns:
- A user-facing instruction message
- A list of available artifacts for that gate, including section structure and evaluation criteria.

You should:
1. Present the list of artifacts to the user
2. Ask them to pick one
3. Use the section metadata to guide the drafting process

gate_id.description:
Which gate the user is preparing for.
- 0: Gate 0 – Verify Business Problem or Opportunity (Pre-Project)
- 1: Gate 1 – Validate Business Justification and Select Short List of Options
- 2: Gate 2 – Approve Preferred Option and Approach
- 3: Gate 3 – Fund Project Deliverables (Project Approval)
- 4: Gate 4 – Confirm Readiness for Service (Pre-Implementation)
- 5: Gate 5 – Complete Project and Post-Implementation Review (Close-Out)

200.description: Returns an instruction message and list of artifacts with section guidance

instructions.description: Message for GPT on how to use the returned data

items.description: Each item is a section intent with metadata

post.summary: Embed and index external policy or strategy documents for use in generation

x-gpt-action.name: Upload Reference Corpus
x-gpt-action.instructions:
Use this when the user uploads foundational docs (e.g. policies, strategies, standards) that need to be embedded and available for alignment.
Fields:
- `file_contents`: full text of the document
- `file_name`: string (e.g. 'Digital Standards 2024')
- `metadata`: object with `title`, `source`, `date` (ISO format)

file_contents.description: Raw document text. Required if file_url is not provided.
file_contents.example: Digital services must be accessible and user-centered...

file_name.description: Name of the file (optional if file_url is provided)

file_url.description: URL to the file (optional if file_contents is provided)

200.description: Document uploaded and processed (synchronously or asynchronously).

status.description: Processing status — 'accepted' for async, 'success' for sync

job_id.description: Only present if background processing was used

chunks.description: Number of chunks created from the uploaded document (sync only)

instructions.description: Guidance to GPT on what to do next

x-gpt-action.name: List Reference Documents
x-gpt-action.instructions: Use this to check what documents have already been uploaded to avoid duplication. It returns a list of document metadata from the reference corpus.

200.description: Returns a list of reference documents in the vector database

post.summary: Record structured research notes for reuse

x-gpt-action.name: Record Research Notes
x-gpt-action.instructions:
Use this tool to store user-provided research notes for later reuse. You must include:
- `session_id`: identifies the session context
- `project_id`: project this research supports
- `notes`: the research content (can be GPT-summarized from a discussion)
You may include structured metadata fields if available.
